openapiUrl.description: Must be an URL leading to a hosted OpenAPI specification.

openapiPath.description: If given, needs to be the path that becomes `openapiUrl` in production. Will use it for generation.

envKeyName.description:
Provide an authorization key that is available as environment variable, to be used as Authorization header (bearer by default) 

 If not given, will not include an Authorization header

operationIds.description: If given, selects only these operationIds from the openapi.

relativeOutputPath.description: Folder directory where SDK should end up

crudSlugPrefix.description: Prefix to use for slugs. Can be useful to keep proper naming

relativeJsonSchemaBasePath.description: Any JSON schemas we need in typescript

openapis.description: Remote or local (partial) OpenAPIs that need to be included in the SDK.

agentConfig.description: Agents that are based on the openapi generated in this server. Each agent will be made available in openapi as well (by proxy). If given, requires OPENAI_SECRET, OPENAPI_SECRET, ADMIN_SECRET env variables to be present, as well as a token [SLUG]_SECRET for every slug

agents.description: An object with slugs as keys and values are the agent settings.

instructions.description: Instructions for the agent. Instead, you can also use markdown to store the instructions.

relativeAgentBasePath.description: If given, the instructions can be found here in [slug].md for each slug

relativeFilePromptBasePath.description: File prompts that need to be accessible through the actionschema CLI

relativeCrudSchemaBasePath.description: CRUD schemas we need to be a CRUD API

data.description: Specifies the datastructures required for the system to work in plain English. Keys are model names.

backend.description: Specifies the API Endpoints needed on the backend

components.description: Idea that I'm brainstorming: could be to create components in a ctml-style way so we can easily make big HTML pages more modular and reducing context.

x-plugin.description: Can be inferred from the specification and the openapi
Claude can implement the specification, based on needed operations, components, and theme
x-plugin.$comment: What if this would be enough to define an agent and it could auto-complete?
